timeline.bodyText: Based on 16 bytes per container-DN combination, it comes to around 16KB for a degenerate case where a container has been in 1000 Datanodes through its lifecycle. Hence, I think we should be OK on the replica history growth over time.
timeline.author: avijayanhwx

replies.bodyText: Each entry costs 32 bytes (4*8). Should be fine anyway.
replies.author: smengcl

timeline.bodyText: Can we add some documentation here on on the ContainerEndpoint API class that Recon can only track first and last seen time of the container replica on a DN. It cannot track intermediate states where a replica can move out a DN and then come back in the future again to the same DN. All Recon guarantees is first and last seen time, and not the whole interval in between the 2 times.

Change-Id: I286d1849455d9ee87c79a9478061d2e03c4bfdf8

Fix ReconContainerManager constructor.

ReconContainerManager is initialized in ReconStorageContainerManagerFacade (impl of OzoneStorageContainerManager), not a Singleton and not initialized directly by Guice injector, so @Inject annotation doesn't work here.
The proper way to do it is pass the ContainerDBServiceProvider to ReconContainerManager in ReconStorageContainerManagerFacade when it is initialized.
